The CountdownClockView struct is a view that displays a countdown clock and allows the user to select a string from a dropdown menu. The struct has several @State properties that store the current time, the seconds, minutes, hours, and days, as well as whether the clock is currently locked. The view also has a switchString() function that allows the user to switch the currently selected string. The view is a NavigationStack and contains several Picker views and buttons for interacting with the clock.
A view representing the buoy’s label. This contains the name and info button
This is the string manager overlay view. It contains a dropdown of the user’s current strings as well as the corresponding buoys inside of them.

The RetrievalTimeView is a SwiftUI view for changing the retrrivel date and time between different “buoy strings.” The view contains a date picker, time picker and a menu for switching between strings
A preview declaration for the DeviceView. Contains placeholder Buoy for testing

The AutoQueRetrievalTime is a SwiftUI view for changing the retrieval date and time between different Buoy Strings. The view contains a date picker, time picker and a menu for switching between Strings.

The AutoQueCountdownClock struct is a view that displays a countdown clock and allows the user to select a string from a dropdown menu. The struct has several @State properties that store the current time, the seconds, minutes, hours, and days, as well as whether the buoy is currently locked. The view also has a switchString() function that allows the user to switch the currently selected string. The view is a NavigationStack and contains several Picker views and buttons for interacting with the clock.
Displays the battery level icon on the side of the DeviceView. Theicon changes based on the given battery percentage of a Buoy.
Creates screen where user is able to view all of their buoys and enable AutoQue feature.
This is the SwiftUI wrapper for the map view. It contains the underlying map box map view as well as the string manager overlay on the left side.
The project’s AppDelegate handles special functions and behaviors of the app. Ex when the app launches/quits
